Sound and spontaneous movement as contextual creative materials and as a means to develop presence.

  • November 14, 2019

Recently, I participated in a workshop on attentive listening in order to create sound experiments both using direct and delayed modes of transmission. Through on-site audio recordings made in collaboration with the artist Christiane Patenaude, we explored sound, movement and performance in a an environment conducive to exchanges and learning. All guided by the wisdom and expertise of artists Sylvie Cotton and Magali Babin. The meditation sessions, followed by experimentation, allowed me to deepen the notion of contemplation – an essential element for creativity.

For more information on the workshop and on the organizers.

Images of the workshop taken by Simon Beaudry (one of the participants).
